headline: Tech Startup Creates AI Assistant for Small Business Owners
content:
ðŸ“° **Tech Startup Creates AI Assistant for Small Business Owners**

**Read time:** 1 minutes

---

Was initiated by Facebook. The event wasn't just about helping small businesses, it also involved various tech companies who attended including Microsoft's Alex Kipman and Airbnb founders John Zimmer (left) & Sebastian Thrun Twitter user @r0tterbx shared photos of Zuckerberg meeting with top CEOs at his announcement on April 12th :- /u/kapha_nelson took some time to share screenshots from an interview he did before or after attending - https://twitter .com/#!/Kapturvitamaskar/status... You can see all posts relating this update here as well..

You won't believe that you can be at the same level as I am now and still have zero experience in coding or marketing due to my long term learning curve! So it's not just me: there are many people who haven`t even gotten started yet (see section above). It is completely possible for beginners of all levels to learn programming by watching some tutorials online using an older version called Ruby on Rails which has had more than half a decade of success with its easy to use interface and extensive documentation like docs.rubyonrailsforge . On top these programs include websites such webdev.

The point is, I've been able to make progress on this in some areas of my work with startups and small businesses â€” but there have always seemed at least as many obstacles along its way: it's definitely an uphill battle; companies are working extremely hard behind closed doors without much transparency or involvement from their users (they're too busy worrying over whether they'll be approved); developers don't understand how important automation could actually become after all these years â€¦.

---
*Daily News | June 27, 2025*
